title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Investment Banking Analysts

content.rendered:
What is an Investment Banking Analyst?

Investment Banking Analysts act as the liaisons between businesses seeking funding and investors looking to fund new and lucrative opportunities. They employ different strategies in order to create financial success for both the company and the investor.

Where does an Investment Banking Analyst work?

  • Finance companies
  • Insurance companies

How much does an Investment Banking Analyst make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an Investment Banking Analyst is $81,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Investment Banking Analysts?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Finance majors
  • Business majors
  • Math majors
  • Economics majors
Explore roles on Handshake

Investment Banking Analyst skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Investment Banking Analysts succeed in their work:

  • Highly detail oriented
  • Good math skills
  • Great interpersonal skills

What are some common questions about Investment Banking Analysts?

Q: Which degree is best for investment bankers?

A: Finance and economics are usually favored, but any general business or math related major work as well!

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, related questions, and common path after college to becoming an Investment Banking Analyst.
